TopicTitle: Air-breathing Engine CoM is really far forward

Articles.Content:
I'm building a tiny little flyer.  When I slap a RAPIER on the back, the center of mass shifts forward, rather than towards the engine.  I've noticed this on two different installs.  It seems to happen with the RAPIER, Wheesly, Whiplash, and Panther, but not with the Juno or Goliath.

Has anyone else run into this? Any known solution?

It is working as intended.  It is meant to convey the fact that in a jet engine most of the mass is not in fact in the nozzle.  It just gets a bit weird when there is no fuselage to actually contain that mass.

 

It also happens with the juno but the small mass may not be noticeable.  The Goliath has is mass centred as it is a complete engine
Thanks for clarifying.  That definitely has an effect on smaller craft...

Try placing one upside down on a rover.

It's COM will drop underneath the ground and it will be pretty much impossible to roll it over.

Lot's of fun exploits with this effect, I hope they never take it out.

Edited March 3, 2016 by Rocket In My Pocket
